metadata.title: CVE-2019-3902 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Mercurial before 4.9. It was possible to use symlinks and subrepositories to defeat Mercurial's path-checking logic and write files outside a repository. It was discovered that Mercurial mishandled symlinks in subrepositories. An attacker could use this vulnerability to write arbitrary files to the target's filesystem.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-3902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 4.8.2-1ubuntu4
mercurial-common - 4.8.2-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mercurial package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.2-1ubuntu4').
